website_summaries.verdict: V-Moda's costly but luxurious-feeling Crossfade Wireless headphones deliver a powerful Bluetooth audio experience with dialed-up bass response.
pros: Intense bass response matched with sculpted, defined highs
Can simultaneously pair with two devices
Included cable with inline remote for passive, wired listening
cons: Sound signature too boosted and sculpted for purists

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've had a pair of wired V-Moda headphones for a few years now and I've loved them. They were getting on a bit, looked quite battered and I wanted to upgrade a to a wireless pair. I thought I'd trial a different brand (B&O) terrible idea, their quality doesn't come close to V-Moda. I sent them back and got a pair of these, one of my better decisions. If you like good quality audio and want wireless I'd recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Vikki Patis

customer_reviews.title: moda
customer_reviews.text: Very good clear punchy sound, plenty bass mids and top... very loud too ... Solid build. big drivers in a small unit... Stock pads too small and thin... Only downside is there is zero soundstage... Its all in your head, not around it, so no real seperation and ambience...
customer_reviews.author: ADi

customer_reviews.title: Just Blown my Mind.
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up from Amazon reduced. Bargain of the century. Done my homework & opted for these. Absolutely delighted.... Awesome
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. C.

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect
customer_reviews.text: Near perfect, just need extra battery you get only 10 hours they only last 3 days, built solid but a bit too rigid comfort suffers after 2 hours, sound is spot on but feel a bit to closed in, perfect for gaming
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!! Will fail and die and you won’t be able to return.
customer_reviews.text: Will not last! Bought these a year ago and have died completely. Are not cheap and for what they are, you can get better alternatives. Would not recomend.
customer_reviews.author: Mr H.

customer_reviews.title: Bass rich headphones, which I like, but good dynamics too.
customer_reviews.text: Bass rich headphones, which I like, but good dynamics too.
customer_reviews.author: Hermes

customer_reviews.title: Produce nice sounds. But it's very tight around the head
customer_reviews.text: Produce nice sounds. But it's very tight around the head. Really hurts. Should have stuck with the wired set
customer_reviews.author: Jay P

customer_reviews.title: Best Wireless Headphones
customer_reviews.text: All V-Moda give you is quality. Sound is incredible, no loss of quality over Bluetooth. These are the best wireless headphones out there at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Headphone reviewer guy

customer_reviews.title: Sick headphones
customer_reviews.text: Only had these a couple days and man are these good, the sound quality is worth the price tag 100 percent recommend these for music lovers, its very low profile design so going out in public with these are great not to small or to big, if you are a gamer like me then these are not for you so look for some other pair if you play a lot of games but other than that worth a buy 👍
customer_reviews.author: calvin

customer_reviews.title: Well built but time has moved on.
customer_reviews.text: Well built comfy headphones. Solid durable cans. Time has moved on these cans are base heavy with limited sound stage. Mids and treble are muted and are reluctant to reveal detail. Unlike Platronic Backbeat II. To be fair the later model of these cans may have remedied these issues. Overall cool looking solid well built cans but other makers do it better for less.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I personally Didn't like these
customer_reviews.text: Sorry didn't like these at all cushions to thin so my ears ached after a short while. Cable when attached was on the right and didn't feel right Very Heavy i know that have Batteries but still to heavy. sound was very good but have heard as good for half the cost. i sent these back and got a refund
customer_reviews.author: Tony Durrant

customer_reviews.title: Bad connection stay away
customer_reviews.text: great base and lovely sounding but the bluetooth connection is absolutely rubbish im talking putting your phone in your pocket and the connection breaking up rubbish. Seriously stay away from them if they was to have put a better bluetooth unit in them they would of been amazing but they chose price over quality and usability
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G. KELSON

customer_reviews.title: ... V moda or something but the sound quality is terrible tried to play music on multiple devices
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I have received a faulty V moda or something but the sound quality is terrible tried to play music on multiple devices, my pioneer decks, iPhone, Computer and results were the same. Sound was very muddy and cheap. Being honest with you, my original apple ear pods sound better and louder than these pair of headphones. I was so excited for them to come and wanted to get a customised shields but i was very disappointed when realised how bad they sound.
customer_reviews.author: Boris C.

customer_reviews.title: these were great headphones UP UNTIL THE POINT WHERE IT STOPPED WORKING
customer_reviews.text: I'm so pissed, these were great headphones UP UNTIL THE POINT WHERE IT STOPPED WORKING, I literally use them during work and left it on my desk and the left side just stopped working out of NOWHERE, $300 you would think these would work for longer than 3 months, I bought them in February! This is so ridiculous, rather have paid 100$ and bough beats.
customer_reviews.author: Delia

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth audio quality turned awful
customer_reviews.text: Initially they were ok, the wired version was great, but bluetooth lagged like if watching youtube videos. The bluetooth quality was also decreased (in terms of EQ, panning, etc) but was something I could live with. But then 2 months in they randomly started having extremely low quality in the bluetooth setting. I know the speakers haven't blown or anything because they still sound normal wired. But anytime you use bluetooth it's extremely fuzzy, like can hardly understand talking. For context, i had V-Moda M-100's (wired version) before and loved them, then got Beats solo2 and also loved them, then got these. Stick with Beats solo bluetooth headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, loudness and battery life!
customer_reviews.text: Don't like sweaty ear pads when working out with them on. Otherwise great sound quality. Nose cancellation is ok as long as the volume is up. Once the song ends you can hear the surroundings. FYI - I'm using the xl replacement pads. They fit better but could still be larger, I still have to take out my 9/16 gauge plugs for them to fit better. They don't stay completely tight on my head when doing decline dumbbell bench presses. Slide down a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Will Completely Blow You Away With Quality Sound
customer_reviews.text: I was stunned at the quality of the sound. Excellent is not even the right word, more like Stupendous. This system actually picks up on the mellowness of fine instruments used in classical recordings such as Steinway or Yamaha concert grand pianos. Was not expecting THAT level of quality. Plus they look nice, are built well, very comfortable and easy to use. They sound as good in Bluetooth mode due to some special engineering. I've read about this company's obsession with quality engineering and quality assurance and control of the production process. This rings true and the proof is the sound! Buy these. You will never regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Astonishing sound quality. The comparison to bose sound true 2 is my measure here. They are beautiful looking and the sound is so crisp. It is the first pair of headphones In which I have never had to raise the volume to the max. You can leave these on quite a few notches below max and get great sound quality. Switching to 320kbps is also highly recommended to make the most of this. That being said comfort wise it falls short. I have read that everyone who switches to XL ear pads are super thrilled with it. The packaging is INSANE. You would think you just bought $1000 headphones.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great although they aren't noise cancelling. I would recommend them for listening to music because the audio is clear and the bass is deep. When I use them to watch TV there is a slight latency which I have to correct on my video software. I would buy these over Beats any day, less expensive but much more durable and the sound quality in my opinion was better than my sons Beats.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B

customer_reviews.title: Its all about the BASS no treble
customer_reviews.text: Upon taking these out of the package i thought to myself these are the ones ive been looking for! They feel indestructible in hand and have a very premium feel. Cushions feel great. Low profile and sits on my head perfectly. Thats where it ends for me. Soundwise the bass just overpowers everything. I listen to alot of film scores, classical,etc and some of the instruments you cant even hear whereas on other headphones you hear them plainly. Even on low volume my ears hurt after a few mins of listening. So if youre a basshead these are for you
customer_reviews.author: Zimmer

customer_reviews.title: Interesting headphones but not for big-heads
customer_reviews.text: I bought these hoping they will fit my big head. Unfortunately, they didn't. Even with XL pads, they were uncomfortable. So, if you have big head, look for something else. They also almost non-breathing, my ears were getting hot very fast which didn't happen with other headphones I owned. Sound quality is ok if you like bass. It can be fun, but they're not easy to listen for a long periods of time. As for wireless, this headphones support SBC codec only , which is ridiculous by today's standards.
customer_reviews.author: Oleksii

customer_reviews.title: These have turned into my go-to headphones for pretty much everything
customer_reviews.text: These have turned into my go-to headphones for pretty much everything. The wireless is very nice though it seem that the Bluetooth capabilities will fritz out on occasion and not pair without reset. That being said, the clarity and base it noticeably better compared to some other high-end headphones of similar price. Good quality build materials means that you aren't afraid of breaking them. Definitely get the XL earpieces as it adds to the comfort and use of these for extended periods. They really should make the XL earpieces standard as opposed to optional.
customer_reviews.author: Ben R.

customer_reviews.title: Was great while it was working
customer_reviews.text: Was great while it was working. But after the battery ran out, I couldn't get it to charge. Didn't last a month. Bought it during my visit in the US. Now that I'm out of the country, not even sure how to send this back. Online registration didn't work as well. Really disappointed. At least it works while wired in. But reason why I bought this was to replace my old wired one.
customer_reviews.author: dreyna

customer_reviews.title: Outrageous sound and quality.....but!
customer_reviews.text: Received these yesterday and tried them out. The sound quality was unbelievably superior. Fit was awesome. The bluetooth worked extremely well. It was most unfortunate that I had to return them due to zero noise reduction. I was two rooms away from my phone listening to the great bluetooth quality and noticed I could also hear the TV in my study playing. I need a set of headphones for when I am using my ride on mower, and want to hear my music on the ipod shuffle. I hope they make these same quality headphones with the noise canceling feature and I will be very happy to reorder right away.
customer_reviews.author: elder

customer_reviews.title: Thoroughly impressed by everything
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is amazing for bluetooth. If you need more or better, hook up the included cord. The battery life is outstanding. I use these primarily for work as I work from home. The mic (built in to the right ear piece) actually works extremely well. I have never had an issue with a conversation. Even better, this switches between my 2 phones automatically most of the time. When it doesn't, I connect through the phone quickly and easily. Comfort is great. I wear them for 2-8hrs/ day and they're the most comfortable set I've owned yet. Build quality seems good. Time will tell. I"ve used them daily for 2 months now with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Great headset, but volume needs finer control
customer_reviews.text: Quick review: Pros: - Noise isolation is relatively good - Construction is VERY sturdy - Comfort is good - Carrying case is a bit awkward but decent Cons: - Major issue: volume control is not very fine. I've had issues getting the audio low enough for certain situations. This may be OK for some people but I really wanted better control. - Minor issue: button placement is a bit odd, being on top of the ear piece, but not a big issue - Very minor: the set tends to squeeze the cups onto the ears a bit. This may put off some people, but not me.
customer_reviews.author: random thoughts

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend. Died after eight months.
customer_reviews.text: I am a headphone collector. I just like to listen thru various headphones. I had these for eight months of rare occasional use as I rotate many. The connection to my smartphone started to become staticky. I tried with PC and same result. Sometimes the signal would drop. So I wrote directly to them and was shocked to basically receive the classic robo canned run around even after I mailed them a full receipt as I was asked to. Unlike what they claim, they are terrible in terms of customer service. I will NOT buy again from Vmoda. Waste of money. Yes, looks nice but the electronics leaves much to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Max™

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than advertised, and don't plan on listening during recharge...
customer_reviews.text: Describing these headphones as "over-ear" is misleading. These are "on-ear", and are less comfortable than they should be because of that. Another issue is that you cannot listen in wired or wireless mode while charging due to static and feedback while the usb chord is plugged in. Other than that, the build quality and packaging are excellent. I have to wonder however, how much of the deluxe packaging is baked into the price. The zippered case is pretty neat, and it's nice to have a 1/4" adapter and a fun little key-chain, but these should be optional. I feel that the headphones by themselves should be in the $70-$90 range without the mandatory extras.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a light weight
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the Crossfade's LP for a while now so I new the audio quality was going to be top notch. My concern was the battery life the wireless set would have. It does not dissapoint! I have been able to get about 12hrs total use out of a single charge. When it's time to recharge it the charging time is really fast. The BT pairing is seamless and gives audio acknowledgement that it has connected to your device. Would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a light weight, solid build BT headset. Combined these with the XL Memory Foam ear cushions and you barely even notice wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Gropp

customer_reviews.title: also with a nice high quality carrying case
customer_reviews.text: Product was packaged in a high grade sleek protective box, also with a nice high quality carrying case. All the cords seem high quality as well. When I paired them with my phone via Bluetooth and pushed play. I immediately smiled. The sound was extremely clean and defined. When I purchased I thought I'd just be using these for gaming, not the case these are the best headphones I've ever heard. Audiophile grade I would imagine. They seem to be made well. Will update if the durability isn't up to par. Can't comment on built in mic as I'm on PC. Will update when I receive my boom mic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, I researched for days and made the right call.  ***3 years later, still great***
customer_reviews.text: Three years in with near daily use and they still work and sound great. Battery life hasnt diminished eitheir, they sound better than the wireless beats and are more durable than bose. ***EDIT 3 Years in*** These headphones are used 5 times a week for the past 3 years, travel on planes, conference calls, battery life is still amazing as is the mic and sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headphones. High quality materials, comfortable, and great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Really love these headphones. Previously used solely Audio-Technica. These are extremely crisp and clear sound quality. The styling is also unmatched. They look fantastic and high quality. I've tried a lot of over-ear headphones and really like how small the cups are on these. You don't look ridiculous when you wear them like most (where the cup size just looks crazy big). Battery life is good too. The boom-pro mic is a nice addition for gaming. Quality is, again, crisp and clear. Though for the price tag these should really come with the mic.
customer_reviews.author: L. Divine

customer_reviews.title: Blown away but Returning it due to one issue
customer_reviews.text: The construction and the sound output of these headphones are absolutely amazing. The Bass is great and the lows/mids/highs are right on point. However, one problem is that these headphones hurt my ears after wearing them on for a few minutes. After about 20 mins, they hurt so bad that I can't continue to use them. Going to return these. If only they didn't hurt my ears, I would give these 5 stars and happily use them.
customer_reviews.author: Rajesh Subramanian

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic wireless cans for the (sale) price
customer_reviews.text: Picked up the Wireless Crossfades and a set of XL pads in grey. For the same price (got them for $99 USD), these are probably the best options out there. Initial pairing with an iPhone 8 Plus takes a bit longer than I’d like, and if you don’t use them paired for a few hours or a day, etc, it sometimes takes 20-30 seconds for them to pair, but other than that - they’re awesome. Sound is what you should expect (don’t use these to master on), and with the XL pads they’re comfortable. I wear glasses BTW. Speaking of the pads - they’re super easy to switch out. Nice work V-Moda!
customer_reviews.author: DJDDay

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, sturdy, good battery life, great sound.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for workouts. I HAD the Plantronics BackBeat FIT 500s, but I didn't like the ON ear feel for longer workouts. The V-Moda's are strong, sturdy, clamp on your head, but not overly so, the hinging earcups are great for when you want to wipe them off and they're an OVER the ear product, so you don't get any pressure on your ear proper. I always keep them in the case and after about a month of use, I'm very happy I got them. Battery life is great as well. I can usually get 5-7 2 hour workouts out of them before recharging them. A fabulous product!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Damore

customer_reviews.title: Durable, beautiful, great sounding headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are about as robust as it gets. It’s almost entirely made of metal and is very well painted. The carrying case protects the headphones well although scratches easily. The Bluetooth is strong and delivers great sound quality. There is no noticeable difference between Bluetooth and cable connection. Battery life is plenty long. Only issue is that the ear pads are too shallow for me. I bought the XL and it helps quite a bit although it still hurts my ears if I wear them for long periods of time. The sound is clear with a good amount of base.Overall great well balanced headphones although not the best for those with big ears.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford Galli

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mids, highs, and loads of bass. Very comfy and wearable for hours on end!
customer_reviews.text: I recently ordered an Audio Technica ATH-M50x, Sennheiser HD 598 Cs, V-Moda Crossfade, Sony MDR7506. The Vmoda (cable only, not bluetooth) blew them all out of the water. I plan on keeping the Sony's for backup casual work listening but these Crossfades are amazing for studio and intense listening. CREAMY bass, brings so much flavor and interest back to music listening. The build is super cool looking as well, love the details. Lightweight braided cable with a hard case for travel, I am completely happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are the best headphones I've owned. I've been a dj for 25 years and I usually go through a pair every year (or two years on average. I'm confident these will last a long time since they are build very well and they have an excellent case design so I always keep them in it. The wired sound quality is excellent and the Bluetooth sound quality is good enough for wireless listening. I love the thin flexible chord. It's one of the best features. Get these if they are in your budget.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan W. Ewell

customer_reviews.title: Device is ok. But mine did not come new ...
customer_reviews.text: Device is ok. But mine did not come new as far as I know. Ear covers were removed and plastic peeled off the included user manual was for a different product then what I had. Box was also damaged. Product does what its supposed to do but due to not being new I am unable to register with v moda insurance policy
customer_reviews.author: mary fryar

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely terrible volume control and massive amounts of static
customer_reviews.text: As soon as you connect to anything with it there is loud static coming out of both speakers which never stops. The lowest volume setting is very, very loud and it only gets louder. Changing the volume makes loud annoying beeps, turning it on makes a loud annoying sound, connecting makes a loud annoying sound, turning it off makes a loud annoying sound. The status LED is very, very bright and never shuts off. It's like a lot of expensive parts went into a very poorly engineered and designed set of headphones. Absolute waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended. Sound is bad and sounstage not centered by company.
customer_reviews.text: Its a good looking headphone. Very unique design , but sounds bad. I listen music regularly and own many headphones including the famous ath-m50x. These sound bad if i compare to them . Most importantly SOUND STAGE IN UNEQUAL. Way more bass in right ear. Feels like music isnt in the center. It gets irritating to me immediately. Fitting isnt great too . Have to keep on adjusting. Hurts ear after half hour use as isnt entirely circumaural. Dont recommend it all .
customer_reviews.author: Udit Asija

customer_reviews.title: A most worthy headphone
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed after buying these on sale for $100. The sound is great and I like how it blocks out plenty of noise but not completely, so I can still hear things around me very faintly. I purchased the XL ear pads based on review recommendations yet I’ve been relatively comfortable working an 8hr job while wearing these. Also I’m afraid to replace the pads because they seem very easy to damage after watching how to videos. Eventually I’ll have the courage to try and replace them. Overall these are the best headphones I’ve ever owned and the quality is excellent
customer_reviews.author: Tonytone222

customer_reviews.title: Broke after less than a year of occasional use
customer_reviews.text: While I originally loved these headphones I regret having purchased these. Less than a year in they won't accept a charge and after reaching out to V-Moda directly I was told that because I bought them through Amazon they aren't covered under any kind of warranty however I can send them back in for 20% off another garbage pair. Screw V-Moda if this is how they treat their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Zak Amos

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, sounds great, battery life is lacking.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my daughter destroyed her last headphones and i wanted something tougher. this is definitely more durable than the skullcandy set she had before. the weight and build are obviously superior, and the noise cancelling and sound quality are great. The only problem is the battery life is about what is advertised, which comparatively speaking to many other headphones on the market is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Miyashiro

customer_reviews.title: Decent Headphones.
customer_reviews.text: These are good for editing music. If you prefer something with more bass like I do, then consider something like the Bludio turbine t2s it has a lot more bass, it's cheaper and in my opinion is louder. It's a good headphone but for that price it's definitely missing somethings. It's been less than a year since I bought it and one side has stopped working with Bluetooth. The cord however is still working fine. I love the way it looks and it's strong. I've fell asleep with these several times and they haven't broke.
customer_reviews.author: Lola B

customer_reviews.title: Great phones
customer_reviews.text: Especially on Amazon lot of reviews are very subjective and most are really biased. I waited for close to 2 years for a deal on good wireless headphones. First Impression: These are phenomenal, sound stage is amazingly great for a closed headphone. Sound is rich and very balanced. I need to burn these for few more weeks. I got these for 180$ a sweet deal. I listen to all kinds of genres Rock, Pop, Classical, Jazz and Indie. These don't cancel noise but isolation of noise is great. This is coming from someone who has Grado sr225e and Senheisser HD598 Cs. These are an absolute steal at this price. If you have the budget go for these, they won't disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: windsurfer

customer_reviews.title: No warranty and horrible customer service.
customer_reviews.text: After five months these still sound good when cabke is connected. Bluetooth quit working and the three button cable provided does not work, had to buy new also cable. After contacting v-Moda they will not warranty because it was bought from a third party on Amazon and they aren't an " authorized vendor". Great sounding when connected by cable. If you buy these get from authorized dealer or you have no warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Stu

customer_reviews.title: Product is good--if you get one that works. V-Moda Customer service? Atrocious.
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are fine, read other reviews for information on that. But... buyer beware. If your headphones arrive with a defect, V-Moda will find every possible excuse to refuse to honor their warranty. Be especially wary of third-party sellers, since V-Moda will claim they are not authorized and will leave you stuck with an expensive paperweight. Big thanks to Mark at Amazon for helping me out with a return and a refund. Customer service reps like you are why I keep coming back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: blazered02

customer_reviews.title: Great usability
customer_reviews.text: ...great sound. They fit really nicely on the ears; snug without being too tight. The only issue I had was getting them to work with my Windows 10 Pro machine. When I use them at work to listen to music through my phone they are awesome. No issues and great sound. The battery usually lasts two days (around 17 hours or more) between charging. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: B. Pendleton

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound quality when wired, but everything else is sup-par, especially for price.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace my Logitech G930 headset for gaming purposes. I purchased the boom mic and Xl memory foam cushions as well. After all that, this was not a quality headset for me. The XL cushions were much larger than the originals on this headset, but they still left considerably less ear space. I could only keep them on for about an hour before my ears starting hurting. This wouldn't be an issue if you have medium or small ears though Also to consider, the wireless mode doesn't work with the boom mic.
customer_reviews.author: Shlean

customer_reviews.title: Almost indestructible
customer_reviews.text: Got these awhile ago. And loved them. Then I came home one night to find that my pit bull loved them too because he used them as a chew toy. Got some replacement ear pads and they worked like they had when I got them. Recently pulled them out to take on a trip and he chewed them again! Ordered another pair of ear pads and they still work great. (I don’t leave them where he can get them he’s just really naughty sometimes) So definitely worth the $300 I spent to get them.
customer_reviews.author: denise veal

customer_reviews.title: Hand crafted? ...Probably why.
customer_reviews.text: After two defective headsets I am returning them for good and going with the original m-100s. The first pair had a mushy button instead of clicky. The second pair has a constant static noise that over powers the right speaker. These aren't cheap, and there is no acception for this. Buyer beware, when working like they should, the headphones are awesome, but maybe I'm just not lucky.
customer_reviews.author: Davidxito

customer_reviews.title: I love the headphones - they work GREAT and they sound ...
customer_reviews.text: HOWEVER - the picture shows the Gunmetal Headphones with the Gunmetal end-plates. What Amazon shipped (twice) was the Gunmetal Headphones - but with Chrome end-plates. Not My Style! I love the headphones - they work GREAT and they sound as good as my wired V-Moda Cross Fade 100s but without the wire! It's great for watching a movie on my iPad while my wife watched the TV - no more "Put your headphones on." Happy Wife = Happy Life. Just watch out for the chrome end-plates - unless you really want to bling anyone looking at you!
customer_reviews.author: Nikon 1

customer_reviews.title: GREAT quality headphones...
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of leaning on them and the ear piece snapped off. This happens often f/when sleeping with them on. This is also when I usually have to buy a new pair or go without but to my pleasant surprise!, these headphones just snapped right back in place and I was "back in business". I am very pleased (and relieved)!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Webb

customer_reviews.title: No battery life, warranty didn't help
customer_reviews.text: I want to love these headphones. The features are great. However, mine can operate on battery for only 5 minutes or so before the battery is dead. I contacted the company's support who instructed me to file a warranty. I filled out the warranty form and paid $15 out of my pocket to ship them in. When I got them back a few weeks later, the battery issue was no better. I can charge them over night, and I still only get 4-5 minutes of use before the battery is dead again. I've followed up with support to see what else can be done, but I have not gotten a response.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic headphones
customer_reviews.text: Prior to these, I was using a pair of Sol Republic V8s which I thought sounded great. The V-Moda Crossfades blow them out of the water. The sound quality is excellent and it does a good job of shutting out most outside noise. They fit decently around my oversize noggin, though the cushions are a little too snug around my ears (they do offer a set of XL cushions for $20 or so, so there's that option). Overall, these were well worth my money.
customer_reviews.author: djseifer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for wireless with bass that could also be used passively. Works perfectly with my phone and tablet. Also get the XL ear pads wow huge improvement in comfort and they sound better too. Love these, just be aware of what you are buying they are not noise cxl, they are not by any means high res head phones. IMO they are by far better than Beats, Urbanites and they look great.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: They are heavy and the sound quality is so bad with absolute no clarity. Battery life is a joke. I wish I had returned them within those 30days.
customer_reviews.author: xgalaxy

customer_reviews.title: Had an issue that right earcup went quiet after hitting it with moderate force.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound with a great balance. However these really leak sound and when I accidentally knocked these on the wall a bit the Right ear sounded less loud and the bass thump dissapeared, the only way I got to fix them was to hit them on my bed to rattle something back in place which was weird.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound, noise cancellation and comfort for large head and ears
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I’m hearing new sounds that I didn’t even know existed in songs I’ve heard a hunted times. With the extra large ear pads I ordered separately, these are the most comfortable headphones I’ve worn on my giant head. Surprisingly great noise cancellation for the price. I wear them at work even when not listening to music. I’m addicted to them.
customer_reviews.author: Buyin stuff

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Pros Great sound Durable Cons Standard cushions are shocking. Did yourself a favour and get the wicked cushions for these. It will change your life. Battery life is short compared to the latest, but not a deal breaker I got mine at $99 which was a no brainier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable headphones with decent sound
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite bluetooth headphones. I prefer them to my Beats and my Bose phones. The over the ear design makes them for all practical purpose noise canceling which is what I prefer since sound canceling headphones typically have poor sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: hbdawg

customer_reviews.title: Were good when they were working
customer_reviews.text: Apparently there is a known issue where V-Moda headphones lose their ability to charge around a year after you buy them. Search Reddit. I had a fairly good experience with them for about 10 months. Then the last month it wouldn't charge. I tried several different chargers - first ones that I had used before, new ones. I am pretty disappointed given how much they stressed quality etc. I contacted support but am unclear what will happen given all of the shutdowns.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable but great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great but the headphones are really uncomfortable. The padding is really small and doesn't provide enough cushion to prevent my ears from touching the inside part. The sound quality doesn't compensate for how uncomfortable they are. My ears are literally hurting while typing this lol
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: PartyPieces is an unauthorized VMODA merchant
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones and they were great but bluetooth broke after six months. When I returned them to VMODA I was told this seller is unauthorized and the warranty was invalid, but I could be a discounted replacement if I like. Grat headphones, but do not buy them from PartyPieces
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Jones

customer_reviews.title: great set of headphones
customer_reviews.text: My wife has a set of V-MODA Crossfade for Djaying and I really liked the way they sounded so, I purchased the wireless model because they are less money however, I don't use them wireless I plug in the external headphone cord. So, there is no lag time for me. So, I am not sure what the lag time is if any.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Cecil Marley Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great sound with a couple of cons, deal breaker to some but depends on what you're looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving these a 5 start, but they still do have their cons Excellent build, great sound Cons, super tight and uncomfortable(had to return), horrible battery life But their sounds are almost as good as the Sony 950N1s which is the biggest compliments I can give!
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Solid pair of bluetooth headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are solid headphones and while I thought they would cover my ears a bit more, they do a great job on delivering great sound. Also got these so I can get customized shields down the road. As for noise canceling its hard to say as my other pair of headphones are the Sony MDR-1000x which are probably the best noise canceling cans on the market. However, for the price, they work great and are my day to day go to headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy What

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: I bought these hoping for a nice set of headphones with real good bass and was hoping these were it. Unfortunately for me the ones i received were defective right out of the box. The sound was very distorted and was peaking at all levels of volume. this was my first experience with this company/headphones so i was extremely disappointed with them and did not order a new pair from this company. I instead went ahead and ordered skullcandy crushers which blow me away with the quality
customer_reviews.author: Nick G

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT headphones!!
customer_reviews.text: I was planning on buying these headphones when they were $150. By chance, they dropped to $100 when I went and ordered them. They are a STEAL at that price! Excellent sound quality over many genres of music (I listen to anything from orchestral, Rock, country, etc.) and they paired right up with my phone out of the box with no issues. I have a big head and they fit rather comfortably. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars - would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -best sound cuality at that price range -stylish look -many customization possibilities -easy switch between wired and wireless mode -pretty comfortable even if you have a huge head like me Cons: -people keep bothering you by asking where did you get such a cool headset -you can hear the guy breathing in a porn film
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: No AAC support over Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the look, feel, and wired sound quality of this headphone. I really wanted to like the wireless sound quality, however, it is very underwhelming. There was some conflicting information online about whether the headphones support Apple’s AAC Bluetooth codec. After working with them for several hours, I can clear this up: the headphones do not support AAC. Bluetooth is SBC only, and is very compressed. Guess I’ll be saving up for the codex edition.
customer_reviews.author: Jake B.

customer_reviews.title: Look a little weird, but they sound great and they are comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I previously purchased Bose and Beats1 Studio 3 and returned them. They both sounded great, but felt like they were crushing my head, and the noise cancellation (I think) made the sound a little less natural. These are much more comfortable, sound more natural and cost a lot less.
customer_reviews.author: Don M. Paluh

customer_reviews.title: Durable, dependable, studio quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones. I have used them with Bluetooth devices and with corded stuff as well and the sound is excellent either way. This is my second set of headphones from this brand, I gave my last pair away as a Xmas gift had them a few years and still worked great.
customer_reviews.author: coderider

customer_reviews.title: Vmoda Rocks
customer_reviews.text: Vmoda makes the best headphones in my opinion. The only thing I could say is that the Bluetooth is not the best as sometimes I turn my head and lose signal from any of my devices, but it's still a great piece of equipment for the price, awesome style, and sound quality!
customer_reviews.author: DrengrZombie

customer_reviews.title: Ho hum...
customer_reviews.text: For $100, it's a decent acquisition. Sonically one can do better. My Audio Technica 50x is leaps and bounds sonically. The battery life is average. The build quality however is tier one.
customer_reviews.author: Uriah Creed

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 14 months
customer_reviews.text: Loved the headphones from day 1, great sound and features, but 14 months after buying (2 months after the warranty expired, grrrr...) the bluetooth stopped working. Still sound great wired, but very disappointed the wireless (battery perhaps?) only went a little over a year.
customer_reviews.author: jcnhwildcat

customer_reviews.title: Great price at my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works well with a bluetooth Transmitter for my TV in addition I take that transmitter and plug it into a sound console and use it for wireless headset mixing church worship services
customer_reviews.author: Edward Scott Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great if they fit your ears- they didn’t fit mine
customer_reviews.text: Even with the extra-large ear cups, these hurt my ears, so I am sending them back. It’s a shame, I liked the sound and the price was great, they were just too small.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: The wired sound is pretty close to the bluetooth sound.
customer_reviews.text: The wired sound is pretty close to the bluetooth sound. I recommend getting the XL pads though. I'm really happy with these; they make my morning commute a lot more bearable and I very seldom see any bluetooth glitches. I can occasionally hear compression artifacts, but nothing terribly significant. These are definitely an acceptable mid-fi accessory. I usually listen to 256 kbps or above encoded MP3s I own a number of high quality wired headphone and these sound nearly as good as any of my wired, closed back headphones.
customer_reviews.author: T. Horst

customer_reviews.title: DAMN!
customer_reviews.text: i had a hard time finding a headset that performed great wireless and corded that wasn't through the roof expensive (and to be honest fit the look i was after). This headset blows my expectations away, and while i'm not an Audio buff i do know what sounds like crap and what doesn't. these are pure gold to you ears. clear highs/mids/bass over bluetooth and even better corded. the build quality is amazing, and these are incredibly comfortable. i would opt for the XL ear pads as i don't have large ears but with the stock ones they can feel cramped after a long time, but the stock ones will do fine. overall: excellent product! would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery performance
customer_reviews.text: Died in less than 2 years when only using every other month for TV watching. Internal battery must be poor quality. Never heard back from manufacturer for warranty. I would recommend skipping and looking t a proven long term product.
customer_reviews.author: Nanuknchato

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, poor range
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of V-Moda headphones in general. I've had the wired ones for years. Sound in the wireless ones is very good, but they have be very close to my phone in order to maintain the connection. Sometimes I can't even keep the phone in my pants pocket.
customer_reviews.author: CGM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing can't beat these!
customer_reviews.text: Second pair gave them as a gift these are great my search for headphones has come to a complete stop. Got them on Black Friday can't beat these for $100. Noise cancellation is only passive but they do block out a good amount so only 4 stars there if it was active NC these would be perfect. Also get the XL earpads it makes all the difference in comfort!
customer_reviews.author: B.Reyna

customer_reviews.title: Hope your ears are miniature
customer_reviews.text: The sound is wonderful, the look is awesome, and they feel very sturdy and like they are made from quality materials. HOWEVER, after about 15 minutes my ears are really sore. I have some of the smallest ears I've ever seen and these do not cover my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get Durability and sound quality for 100 bucks
customer_reviews.text: I work hard labor and often use these through terrible conditions. I also play basketball and have worn these practicing, multiple times has the side with the on/off button/ volume popped out. I just pop it back in and the sound quality never changed. For a hundred bucks u got a great battery, it’s durable as hell, and the sound quality is on par with much more expensive head phones. Would recommend over ANY headphones on Amazon. After how terrible I’ve treated these headphones they work like a charm!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great workmanship
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I took the plunge & ordered these. They look great & sound great. One thing that stands out for me is they are solid build. You do not need to be delicate with these. I use them for running, they stay on there place & feel great. I have normal year pads , I don't feel them small or uncomfortable, guess I have small ears.... If you are on the fence go ahead & order, won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: It is awesome. The sound is great. They do occasionally cut out however that doesn't bother me. I do have to constantly reconnect them on my iPhone after a phone call when I disconnect them because my Macbook grabs the connection. But that is a human issue because I don't like to talk with headphones on. These are sturdy and quality is great. These look better than my co-workers that shelled out even more for theirs.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Not a good investment.
customer_reviews.text: Ok so.... These sound great and functionally are wonderful..... For a couple hours. Then the battery is dead and they will not charge during use making these a very dubious choice. I wouldn't buy them again at any price.
customer_reviews.author: K. R.

customer_reviews.title: All Bass and Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: So these headphones were great especially for $99.99 price. Deep bass and crisp treble. But there is little to no midrange. This is the sound signature they are going for. Therefore, they sound terrible with rock and metal music. I would not recommend for that style of music. Build quality is outstanding though.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware, not an authorized dealer!
customer_reviews.text: Only work 30% of the time and I’ve had them less then 2 months. Since it’s been over 30 days the seller won’t take a return. Also they are not authorized dealers. So V Moda won’t help me either......
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Dodd

customer_reviews.title: the quality is amazing. However
customer_reviews.text: If you just want to use this as a set of headphones, which is what I wanted, the quality is amazing. However, I found that in order to use the built-in headset feature, you must switch the playback audio device on your computer to the headset setting which reduces the audio quality to garbage and the mic also sounds terrible. I only had to use this because my mic temporarily broke so I never planned on using it, but just a heads up, the recording portion of this device is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Elmore

customer_reviews.title: Every thing ok till Dic 2018
customer_reviews.text: I been using this item from July 21 2018 everything was Ok till Dic 2019 after that time the bateries are dead they don't gets charge, I can used only wired.
customer_reviews.author: Yamil Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: Bass is Booming but Bluetooth is Busted
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for less than a year and the Bluetooth stopped working, and since I bought them through a third party seller (Best Buy Deals) V-MODA won’t honor their warranty and replace them. The battery is dead and doesn’t recharge when plugged in. But they still work as wired headphones, and really push the bass frequencies. But not being wireless will definitely limit my use of them.
customer_reviews.author: FillmorJive

customer_reviews.title: Worth their retail price, a steal on sale!
customer_reviews.text: Great product at this price, stylish, durable, good quality and manufacturing. Sound is a bit bright at times, strong bass, wish It had mire mids. Wired connection is available when battery is out, that being said strong battery life 10hrs + Get the XL pads it's worth it!. I use them now mostly wired to my LG V20, really makes these things sing!
customer_reviews.author: D. Motta

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are just amazing and a steal for the price. If you like quality, loudness, bass and precision these might be for you. Couldn't be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Audiophiles need to give this one a try.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones paired up quickly to my LG OLED 4K tv, and somewhat lightweight and comfortable to wear for hours at a time. They also produce very rich tones with a nice bass that's not too overpowering like some other headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Saint Sylar

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good headphones they are very durable haven’t used the ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good headphones they are very durable haven’t used the Bluetooth yet . They sound great. I think they might have felt a little tight on my head at first and the ear cups aren’t that soft but not terrible heard
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Well built and stylish
customer_reviews.text: Have only used for a few days now but so far very happy. I primarily use them outside while working on the property. There are certainly better makes on the market for twice the cost but I needed a strong, well built set that could take a little punishment and I think these will hold up very well. Was a little concerned about battery life with Bluetooth and high volume, but after 7 hours of both they were still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Len A. Shultz

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good cans
customer_reviews.text: Good cans. The sound quality is good overall, not as good as my Westone in ear phones or my B&O H2's, but good. Connects easily to iPhone for BT and that is really why I got them. Just be aware, they are pretty big and they do not fold up at all. The case is shaped just like the photo of the item.
customer_reviews.author: D. Garrett

product_meta.title: V-MODA Crossfade Wireless Over-Ear Headphone - Gunmetal/Black, One Size
product_meta.description:
Colour Name:BlackCrossfade Wireless gives you the best of both worlds: wireless via Bluetooth technology for ultimate freedom, wired if you run out of juice or just want to enjoy pure analog mode with your own headphone amp or DAC. Either way, you still get V-MODA Crossfade's award-winning signature sound. Unlike other wireless headphones, inserting a cable plug into the headphone jack instantly switches off all electronics to achieve zero latency, which is essential for gamers and DJs. Just pair your Crossfade Wireless to a Bluetooth device and enjoy your headphones up to 33 feet (10 meters). They can also be paired with two sources at the same time such as smartphone laptop or smartphone smart watch (specially tuned antenna to work with all smart watches on the market). The built-in hidden microphone is specially tuned and optimized for phone calls and voice recognition and a rugged Kevlar-reinforced 1-Button Speakeasy cable for wired use is included in the box. Crossfade Wireless keeps faith with V-MODA heritage thanks to the luxurious combination of steel and new vegan leather, meeting military-level standards of the MIL-STD-810G testing guidelines. Memory foam ear cushions physically block noise and provide supple ergonomic comfort for extended listening sessions. The cushions and Steelflex headband adapt to your head and ears to create perfect natural noise isolation, optimal bass and an immersive 3D soundstage. The rechargeable lithium-ion battery provides up to 12 hours of continuous music, entertainment and calls. Recharging is easy thanks to the included elegant V-Micro USB cable. Discover V-MODA world via Crossfade Wireless and enjoy our unrivaled Six-Star customer support, Immortal Life Replacement Program and 1-Year Premier Warranty.

BOX CONTAINS
Crossfade Wireless 
Exoskeleton carry case 
Carabiner clip 
Reinforced 1-Button SpeakEasy Microphone & Mic cable 
Elegant V-Micro USB cable 
V-MODA sticker 
Six-Star Service 
1-Year Premier Warranty 
50% Immortal Life Program
feature_bullets: Crossfade’s award-winning sound (50+ editors’ choice awards)
Built-in hidden microphone specially tuned and optimized for phone calls and voice recognition

Lithium-ion battery provides up to 12 hours of continuous music, entertainment and calls. Recharge it to 100% in 100 minutes thanks to the included elegant V-Micro USB cable; unlimited hours of music in analog wired mode

Dual-diaphragm 50mm driver is a refined version of the award-winning Crossfade M-100 that was crowdsourced by hundreds of audiophiles and won 20+ editors’ choice awards, unrivaled speaker consistency, perfectly balanced air flow mechanics and materials

Luxurious material combination of steel and new vegan leather, meeting military-level standards of the MIL-STD-810G testing guidelines, memory foam cushions and headband provide comfort for extended listening sessions and natural noise isolation
Built-in amplifier featuring VAMP technology for more powerful, musical and clear sound
Available in 4 colors: Gunmetal Blach, Phantom Chrome, White Silver and Rouge

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
